tests.title: CT 1: The Fundamental Unit of Life
tests.description: Cell structure & functions, cell organelles, plant & animal cells, plasma membrane, nucleus, mitochondria, chloroplast, ER, Golgi, lysosomes.

tests.title: CT 2: Tissues
tests.description: Plant tissues – meristematic, permanent; Animal tissues – epithelial, connective, muscular, nervous.

tests.title: CT 3: Life Processes
tests.description: Nutrition (plants & animals), respiration, transportation, excretion.

tests.title: CT 4: Control and Coordination
tests.description: Nervous system, brain, reflex action, coordination in plants, hormones in animals.

tests.title: CT 5: How do Organisms Reproduce?
tests.description: Modes of reproduction – asexual, sexual, human reproductive system, reproductive health.

tests.title: CT 6: Heredity
tests.description: Mendel’s experiments, laws of inheritance, sex determination, variation.

tests.title: CT 7: Matter in Our Surroundings
tests.description: States of matter, properties, change of state, latent heat, evaporation.

tests.title: CT 8: Is Matter Around Us Pure?
tests.description: Mixtures, types, separation methods, compounds vs mixtures.

tests.title: CT 9: Atoms and Molecules
tests.description: Laws of chemical combination, Dalton’s theory, writing chemical formula, mole concept.

tests.title: CT 10: Structure of the Atom
tests.description: Electrons, protons, neutrons, models (Thomson, Rutherford, Bohr), distribution of electrons.

tests.title: CT 11: Chemical Reaction and Equation
tests.description: Types of reactions, writing balanced equations, effects of oxidation/reduction.

tests.title: CT 12: Acids, Bases and Salts
tests.description: Properties, reactions with metals, indicators, neutralization, common salts.

tests.title: CT 13: Metals and Non-metals
tests.description: Physical & chemical properties, reactions, occurrence, uses.

tests.title: CT 14: Carbon and its Compounds
tests.description: Bonding, versatile nature, hydrocarbons, functional groups, nomenclature, important compounds.

tests.title: CT 15: Motion
tests.description: Distance, displacement, speed, velocity, acceleration, graphs, equations of motion.

tests.title: CT 16: Forces and Laws of Motion
tests.description: Balanced/unbalanced forces, Newton’s laws, inertia, momentum.

tests.title: CT 17: Gravitation
tests.description: Universal law, free fall, mass & weight, buoyancy, Archimedes’ principle.

tests.title: CT 18: Work and Energy
tests.description: Work, power, kinetic & potential energy, work–energy theorem.

tests.title: CT 19: Sound
tests.description: Production, propagation, properties, speed, reflection, applications.

tests.title: CT 20: Light – Reflection and Refraction
tests.description: Reflection laws, spherical mirrors, refraction, lenses, ray diagrams.

tests.title: CT 21: The Human Eye and the Colourful World
tests.description: Structure of eye, defects & corrections, refraction through prism, atmospheric refraction.

tests.title: CT 22: Electricity
tests.description: Electric current, potential difference, resistance, Ohm’s law, series/parallel circuits, heating effect.

tests.title: CT 23: Magnetic Effects of Electric Current
tests.description: Magnetic field, right hand rule, electromagnet, electric motor, electromagnetic induction.

tests.title: CT 24: Improvement in Food Resources
tests.description: Crop production, improvement, animal husbandry, poultry, fisheries.

tests.title: CT 25: Our Environment
tests.description: Ecosystem, food chains, waste management, ozone depletion.
